pros: Lots of opportunities for career progression within different departments.  I was able to complete two different job roles in different departments and this added variety And flexibility to my role. Regular feedback from managers in regards to performance, training aims and needs. Felt like I was really valued and appreciated by my colleagues and superiors. Lots of great staff benefits such as discounts in the local area.
cons: Not fantastic pay but what can you expect from the public sector in the current climate.

review_title: Poor Senior Management & Culture of Overworking
pros: The immediate team was friendly and supportive.
cons: There is a disconnect between staff needs and the actions of senior management. The pay is significantly lower than average, especially since staff are so overworked. There also aren’t any spaces for staff to take their lunch, that isn’t at their desk.

pros: Free parking Hour lunch break Early finish on Fridays Good holiday entitlement
cons: Too much is expected of you for a minimum wage position. The staff offices are dirty and unhygienic never getting cleaned/hoovered. Management are not supportive and no chance of progression.

pros:
Fair pay
Holidays
Pension
Salary increase per annum
Management team
cons: I think the management structure could be a little better.

pros: Good colleagues good facilities good technology
cons: Poor management high workload expected to work unpaid overtime

job_title: Employability and Skills Tutor in Grimsby, England
cons: Some tutors are considered support staff so do not receive the same benefits or pension contributions, yet are held to the same standards as "academic" tutors.

pros: Good employee engagement strategies with recognition for strong performance.
cons: Limited opportunity for progression with academic areas

pros: Having worked here for a good few years, I can definitely say this is one of the best employers I have worked for. Lots of opportunities to develop, a flexible working environment and a great benefits package.

review_title: Culture of fear. Bullying senior management team.
pros:
Free CPD courses available (if you can be granted the time to commit to them) 
The bakery is good for lunch 
Well equipped resources for teaching sessions
cons:
Low morale. Sometimes feared going into work. Management are absolute bullies. 
If you want to work for a company where you look back and think .. Wow, did I really put up with that? Then maybe this is for you!?

review_title: Enjoyed the majority of time there. Then the restructures started...
cons: Appears to be who you know at times rather than what you know

pros: Great place to work,  providing "education with heart".
cons: FE is undergoing challenging times. However, this should soon be mitigated by improved demographics.

pros:
Its easy to hide inadequacies in performance as with few exceptions management is barely adequate.
Also easy to maintain good work life balance as, beyond fear, there is no incentive to do more than is absolutley necessary to get by.
cons: Poor morale. Culture of fear. No sense of worth.

job_title: Program Leader for Sports in Scarborough, England
pros: Great member of staff to work along side from different departments.
cons: Low amount of staff for the courses they deliver.
Management needs improving, pay is not good enough

review_title: Racists and  two face uncivilized society
cons: You're small minded, and always will be. Shame on you
